articles.headline: Trump Taps Wall St. Executive Howard Lutnick for Commerce Secretary
articles.snippet: The billionaire executive and leader of President-elect Donald J. Trump’s transition team will be charged with promoting U.S. industry and overseeing technology controls on China.
articles.abstract: The billionaire executive and leader of President-elect Donald J. Trump’s transition team will be charged with promoting U.S. industry and overseeing technology controls on China.
articles.lead_paragraph: President-elect Donald J. Trump picked Howard Lutnick to serve as commerce secretary on Tuesday, tapping a billionaire Wall Street executive for one of the most prominent and increasingly powerful economic positions in the federal government.
articles.byline: By Ana Swanson and Alan Rappeport

articles.headline: For Russia, Nuclear Weapons Are the Ultimate Bargaining Chip
articles.snippet: The Ukraine war has not only shattered millions of lives and shaken Europe. It also has inured Washington to the use of nuclear threats as leverage.
articles.abstract: The Ukraine war has not only shattered millions of lives and shaken Europe. It also has inured Washington to the use of nuclear threats as leverage.
articles.lead_paragraph: On the 1,000th day of the war in Ukraine, President Volodymyr Zelensky took advantage of Washington’s new willingness to allow long-range missiles to be shot deep into Russia. Until this weekend, President Biden had declined to allow such strikes using American weapons, out of fear they could prompt World War III.

articles.headline: How Google Spent 15 Years Creating a Culture of Concealment
articles.snippet: Trying to avoid antitrust suits, Google systematically told employees to destroy messages, avoid certain words and copy the lawyers as often as possible.
articles.abstract: Trying to avoid antitrust suits, Google systematically told employees to destroy messages, avoid certain words and copy the lawyers as often as possible.
articles.lead_paragraph: In late 2008, as Google faced antitrust scrutiny over an advertising deal with its rival Yahoo and confronted lawsuits involving patent, trademark and copyright claims, its executives sent out a confidential memo.

articles.headline: Grieving Parents Ask: Should They Freeze Their Dead Son’s Sperm?
articles.snippet: In Israel, the military is now offering to preserve the sperm of soldiers killed in war. Parents and widows are struggling with the decision.
articles.abstract: In Israel, the military is now offering to preserve the sperm of soldiers killed in war. Parents and widows are struggling with the decision.
articles.lead_paragraph: Avi Harush heard a knock on his door in early April and saw Israeli military officers outside. Instantly he knew that his son, Reef, a 20-year-old soldier who had been sent to Gaza, was dead. The officers gave him the news, and then asked an unexpected question: Did the family want doctors to extract and freeze his son’s sperm? Mr. Harush was gutted with grief, but comforted by the notion of preserving a living memory of his child. He quickly agreed.

articles.headline: Russia Intensifies Assaults on an Exhausted Ukraine
articles.snippet: Overextended Ukrainian forces lack manpower and artillery against Russian forces willing to absorb staggering casualties.
articles.abstract: Overextended Ukrainian forces lack manpower and artillery against Russian forces willing to absorb staggering casualties.
articles.lead_paragraph: A small band of Ukrainian soldiers was trapped. They were holding the line on the battlefield, but Russian forces had managed to creep in behind their trench and encircle them.
articles.byline: By Marc Santora and Tyler Hicks

articles.headline: Harris Loss Has Democrats Fighting Over How to Talk About Transgender Rights
articles.snippet: Kamala Harris left Donald J. Trump’s anti-transgender attack ads largely unanswered. Some Democrats call it political malpractice.
articles.abstract: Kamala Harris left Donald J. Trump’s anti-transgender attack ads largely unanswered. Some Democrats call it political malpractice.
articles.lead_paragraph: In the weeks before Election Day, aides to Kamala Harris could see in campaign polling that Donald J. Trump’s attacks on Ms. Harris’s support for transgender rights were driving away swing voters.
articles.byline: By Adam Nagourney and Nicholas Nehamas

articles.headline: Comcast to Spin Off Cable Networks, Including MSNBC and CNBC
articles.snippet: The new publicly traded company is set to debut next year, with a bundle of channels that also includes Oxygen, E! and Syfy.
articles.abstract: The new publicly traded company is set to debut next year, with a bundle of channels that also includes Oxygen, E! and Syfy.
articles.lead_paragraph: Comcast said Wednesday that it would spin off its cable networks, including MSNBC and CNBC, in a bid to unshackle its movie studio and theme parks from the waning fortunes of traditional television.

articles.headline: Target’s Stock Plunges 21% on Weak Sales Ahead of Holiday Season
articles.snippet: The retailer’s downbeat earnings report, which included lower profit and larger inventory, fell far short of Wall Street’s expectations.
articles.abstract: The retailer’s downbeat earnings report, which included lower profit and larger inventory, fell far short of Wall Street’s expectations.
articles.lead_paragraph: Target rattled Wall Street on Wednesday with a downbeat earnings report showing a sales decline, lower profit and an unwelcome buildup of unsold inventory. The company also cut its forecast for the full year, a bad omen ahead of the critical holiday shopping season.
